petri.api
Class PolygonActor

java.lang.Object
  petri.api.Actor
      petri.api.PolygonActor
Direct Known Subclasses:
Paddle, Particle
public abstract class PolygonActor
extends Actor

A variant of Actor that draws itself with a Polygon. Useful for drawing shapes.

Author:
Cody Swendrowski

Constructor Summary
PolygonActor(GameEngine e)
          Creates a new Actor.
 
Method Summary
 void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
          Draws the Actor.
 java.awt.Polygon getDrawnPoly()
          Returns Polygon used for drawing
 void setBasePoly(java.awt.Polygon poly)
          Sets the basePoly, which is the default shape of the Actor, to a new Polygon.
 void setCenter(float x, float y)
          Sets the center of the Actor by first transforming the basePoly (and drawPoly if not null) to (0,0), then transforms to new center.
 void setCenterLines(boolean cl)
          Sets if the PolygonActor should draw lines from all points in the Polygon to the center.

setCenter

public void setCenter(float x,
                      float y)
Sets the center of the Actor by first transforming the basePoly (and drawPoly if not null) to (0,0), then transforms to new center.

Overrides:
setCenter in class Actor
Parameters:
x - X co-ordinate of center
y - Y co-ordinate of center

setCenterLines

public void setCenterLines(boolean cl)
Sets if the PolygonActor should draw lines from all points in the Polygon to the center. This is used as a nice visual effect without affecting collision efficiency.

Parameters:
cl - if true, draws center lines.
